solution_line_template: He wants to rent for {total_rental_days} days and there is a deal if you rent for {deal_days} days so that leaves {total_rental_days}-{deal_days} = <<{total_rental_days}-{deal_days}={individual_days}>>{individual_days} individual days

Each individual day is ${cost_per_day} and he will have {individual_days} individual days for a total of {cost_per_day}*{individual_days} = $<<{cost_per_day}*{individual_days}={cost_individual_days}>>{cost_individual_days}
{deal_days} days costs ${cost_14_days} and {individual_days} days costs ${cost_individual_days} for a total of {cost_14_days}+{cost_individual_days} = ${total_cost}
